qas.question: In 2010 youtube launched a version of its site that ran on what standard?
What was the main benefit from the switch to HTML5?

answers.text: allowed videos to be viewed without requiring Adobe Flash Player

qas.question: How did users opt into the trial version of youtube's HTML5 site?
What format besides H.264 was playable with HTML5?

plausible_answers.text: YouTube launched an experimental version of the site that used the built-in multimedia capabilities of web browsers supporting the HTML5 standard

qas.question: What format besides H.264 was playable with HTML4?

plausible_answers.text: allowed videos to be viewed without requiring Adobe Flash Player

qas.question: What was the main benefit from the switch to HTML4?
When did YouTube launch a version of its site that supported the HMLT5 standard?
What was no longer required with the support of HMLT5?
What were browsers supporting in order to use the H.642 or WemB formats?
